paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR Gly83Arg mutation, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: familial amyloid polyneuropathy with ocular manifestations

individual_records.phenotype_details: ocular manifestations including severe vitreous opacities, secondary glaucoma, xerophthalmia, dyscoria, and attenuated retinal arteries
individual_records.evidence_sentence: All 12 affected individuals in the family had ocular manifestations, including severe vitreous opacities, secondary glaucoma, xerophthalmia, dyscoria, and attenuated retinal arteries.

functional_data.summary: Congo red staining demonstrated amyloid deposits in the vitreous, and immunohistochemical staining confirmed the deposition of TTR proteins in the vitreous.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation co-segregated with the disease phenotype and was absent in 100 normal controls.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was confirmed in all affected individuals and absent in normal controls.
key_quotes: Direct sequencing revealed the heterozygous missense mutation in TTR (c.307 C>G p.Gly83Arg) in all 12 affected individuals.
The mutation co-segregated with the disease phenotype and was absent in 100 normal controls.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
